item.title: Dead Men Don't Count
item.description: Dead Men Don't Count is a 1968 Spanish-Italian Spaghetti Western film written and directed by Rafael Romero Marchent.

item.title: Johnny West il mancino
item.description: Left Handed Johnny West is a 1965 Italian spaghetti western film directed by Gianfranco Parolini.

item.title: White Comanche
item.description: White Comanche or Comanche blanco or Rio Honcho is a 1968 paella western starring William Shatner in two roles.

item.title: Duello nel Texas
item.description: Duello nel Texas, also known as Gunfight at Red Sands and Gringo, is a 1963 Italian/Spanish international co-production directed by Ricardo Blasco and Mario Caiano, and produced by Albert Band as his first spaghetti western. It was also the first Western to feature a score by Ennio Morricone and the second spaghetti western to star Richard Harrison.

item.title: Garringo
item.description: Garringo is a 1969 Spanish-Italian Spaghetti Western film written and directed by Rafael Romero Marchent.
